org.openpnp.machine.reference.vision

Class ReferenceFiducialLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openpnp.model.AbstractModelObject
      • org.openpnp.machine.reference.vision.AbstractPartSettingsHolder
        • org.openpnp.machine.reference.vision.ReferenceFiducialLocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable, PartSettingsHolder, PartSettingsRoot, FiducialLocator, PropertySheetHolder

    public class ReferenceFiducialLocator
extends AbstractPartSettingsHolder
implements PartSettingsRoot, FiducialLocator
    Implements an algorithm for finding a set of fiducials on a board and returning the correct orientation for the board.

      • getBestFiducials

        public static java.util.List<Placement> getBestFiducials(java.util.List<Placement> fiducials)
        Gets the best fiducials from the given list. If there are at least three fiducials that are non-colinear, the three that are most distant from one another will be returned. Otherwise the two most distant ones will be returned. If there are less than three fiducials in the list altogether then the list is returned unchanged. Note that given the above rules, the returned list can contain 0, 1, 2, or 3 fiducials. No other number of results will be returned.
        Parameters:
        fiducials -
        Returns:

      • getHomeFiducialLocation

        public Location getHomeFiducialLocation(Location location,
                                        Part part)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Given a placement containing a fiducial, attempt to find the fiducial using the vision system. The function first moves the camera to the ideal location of the fiducial based on the board location. It then performs a template match against a template generated from the fiducial's footprint. These steps are performed thrice to "home in" on the fiducial. Finally, the location is returned. If the fiducial was not able to be located with any degree of certainty the function returns null.
        Specified by:
        getHomeFiducialLocation in interface FiducialLocator
        Parameters:
        location, - part
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
